name: Silver leaf replica earrings with peridot
description: These are fine silver replicas of trumpet vine leaves, with natural peridot cabochons set into fine silver bezel cups.  The earrings are asymmetrical, because they are replicas of natural leaves, no two of which are exactly alike.  Each earring is approximately 1 3/8" long.  The ear wires are sterling silver.

name: Mexican Opal Tag
description: This is a large fine silver tag, one of a kind, made from Precious Metal Clay.  It measures 2 3/8" x 1 3/8".  The flat Mexican opal cabochon is held in a fine silver bezel with faux rivets.  This is a colorful piece with green fire in the opal and a multi-colored patina.  The 12mm fine silver jump ring is not fused.  The rubber neck cord is sold separately.

name: Rubber necklace cord with sterling clasp
description:
This cord is 4 mm in diameter, which makes it appropriate for a large, heavy pendant.  I have made them in lengths from approximately 18" to @ 22", with sterling silver end caps that have a hook and eye closure.  
The hook can be squeezed a little tighter when the cord is being worn in order to prevent its accidentally unhooking itself!  Be sure to specify the approximate length you want when you are ordering.

name: Sterling silver 3mm 20" foxtail chain
description: This is a beautiful and versatile chain.  I did not make it myself, but I have used it often with large-ish handmade fine silver pendants.  Considering the cost of silver (which seems to continue to go up), I am offering many pendants for sale with no chain or with a less costly alternative; so I decided to offer silver chains for sale separately.

name: Milagro Tag
description: This fine silver tag displays a large milagro from Oaxaca as well as a genuine squished Mexican beer bottle cap.  The design has been enhanced with a patina and a bit of acrylic paint.  The tag is 2.5" (6cm) by 1.5" (3.7cm) and is fitted with a fused 12mm fine silver jump ring.

name: Big Blue-eyed Pirate Calavera
description: Another piece inspired by Dias de los Muertes in Mexico. This pirate is made of fine silver with a blue cubic zirconium eye (and an eyepatch) and a sterling silver hoop earring. He measures 1.75" x 1.2".  A large hidden bail will accommodate a heavy chain or cord.  This pendant will come with a rubber cord with a sterling silver hook-and-eye closure.  The woven 22' sterling chain in one of the pictures is sold separately.

name: Spinning Skull Ring #3
description: Fine silver ring with a spinning triple-skull raku bead.  This one is size 7.5 and the band is textured with an art nouveau style rose design.  This is the third spinning skull ring that I am listing.  If you would like a specific size and/or band design combination not shown here, please let me know and I will make it and list it for you.

name: Spinning Skull Ring #2
description: Fine silver ring with triple-skull raku bead which spins!  The design on this band is a "language of the goddess" from ancient pottery.  This ring is size 8.5.  I have made similar rings in other sizes, and I will list some of them soon.  These rings were made in honor of Dias de los Muertes.

name: Spinning Skull Ring #1
description: Fine silver ring, size 9, with triple-skull raku bead riveted on in such a way that it can spin.  We're going to call this band design "lace", because I used a piece of lace to make it.  I have more of these rings, with different band designs and in different sizes, and I am in the process of listing them here in my shop.  I made the first 2 rings of this type in preparation for my recent trip to Oaxaca during the Day of the Dead celebrations.

name: "The Answer Comes Up Every Day" pendant
description: This pendant is a flat disc of fine silver with a raised sun in 22k gold and a banner proclaiming "the answer comes up every day".  This could mean solar power, as the answer to the problem of finding renewable energy, but the phrase could also have a more metaphysical meaning, as in "every day brings new answers to our old questions".  The design is original and the pendant is handmade; it measures 1.3" (3.4cm) in diameter, and has a large sterling jump ring attached.

name: "Don't Worry Be Happy" Buddha tag
description: This is one of my large tags, measuring 6cm by 3.5cm.  The Buddha face is molded from a "laughing Buddha" figure given to me by a dear friend on my 21st birthday almost 50 years ago!  The affirmative saying, "Don't Worry Be Happy" seems to go appropriately with this face, which has helped me find a more cheerful outlook over the years.  If you order it, it will come with an oversized sterling jump ring, hand-made by me. The tag itself is hand-made of fine silver from precious metal clay.

name: Fine silver and gold heart earrings
description: The texture/pattern on these fine silver earrings is from an antique book cover--I love the embossed and debossed designs on very old books, and I have made molds from the antique books that I own.  You will see these designs transferred onto a lot of the jewelry that I make from metal clay, and chances are that you won't see them anywhere else!  The smaller hearts are raised and display a layer of 22k gold.  The earwires are gold-filled.  Each heart measures a little over 2cm (.75") across.

name: Calavera Pendant
description: This lovely lady has sparkling orange cubic zirconia for eyes and wears a flower in her . . . well, where her hair would be.  Handmade of fine silver, she comes with an 18" sterling snake chain with lobster clasp.  The hidden bail will accommodate a thicker chain or cord.  The piece measures 3.5 cm tall and is 3 cm at the widest point.  Don't wait for Dia de los Muertos to come around again--be daring and wear your calavera year-round!

name: Calavera Charm
description: My very first calavera, a festively decorated skull representing Dias de los Muertes.  In Mexico the attitude towards death seems to be:  "Death is the mother of beauty".  I was thrilled to be able to experience Dias de los Muertes in Oaxaca this fall and was inspired to create my own calaveras.  This one is small enough to be called a "charm" (2.5 cm by 2 cm) but can be worn as a pendant.  It is made of fine silver with cubic zirconia, and it comes with a large sterling jump ring so that it can be worn on a chain, attached to a bracelet, used as a zipper-pull, or whatever your fancy!

name: Hecate, Guardian of the Crossroads
description: Bronze pendant depicting Hecate as the triple goddess, brandishing a torch to light your way and weapons to defend you against all comers.  The snakes are companion animals to the Goddess.  The pendant is approximately 3 cm across, and it comes with a sterling jump ring on a woven cotton cord with a sterling clasp.

name: "Language of the Goddess" earrings
description: This design was adapted from an illustration in the book "The Language of the Goddess" by Marija Gimbutas.  They are about 2 cm in length, made of fine silver and 24k gold on sterling earwires.  Of course they are made entirely by hand from silver and gold metal clay, kiln fired and torch-fired.

name: Goddess with Winged Dogs ring
description: This is a fine silver ring with a bronze disc riveted on top.  This ring was in an exhibition called "Symbolism:  Cultural Messages" at Purdue University this past summer.  The card that accompanied the ring reads  "Themes of transformation and becoming inform this Minoan design.  The goddess, in her epiphany as honeybee, is accompanied by winged dogs, stimulators of the life force."  The ring is about size 8 and the disc is 2.2 cm in diameter (7/8").  I can make it in another size, but of course there will be a wait time of about 4 weeks.  The patina shown in the photo is subject to change over time.  (truth in advertising)

name: Goddess with Lion pendant
description: The Minoan goddess with her companion animal, the lion.  This ancient design is reflected in the Tarot card representing strength.  The goddess, as "mistress of the beasts", dominates untamed nature but not by means of conflict--she represents the strength of harmony in the natural world.  The lion also represents the unconquerable strength of life which continually renews itself.  This pendant measures 5.5 cm by 4.25 cm, and is made of fine silver.  It comes with a rubber cord and a sterling silver clasp.

name: Bronze Minoan Goddess Pendant
description: Made from bronze metal clay, this pendant depicts a mythic Minoan scene in which you can see the goddess and her attendants with many of her symbols:  poppy seedpods (dream, ecstasy, the unconscious mind), the labyris, or double axe (life/death, regeneration, the butterfly), the tree of life, the sun and the moon.  The pendant measures @ 4cm by 6cm, and will come with a black rubber neck cord and clasp (not pictured).

name: Textured links earrings 2
description: Fine silver links textured on both sides, lightly patinaed, on sterling earwires.  The larger link measures 1.5cm in diameter, and the length of the earring (not including the wires) is 2.5cm.

name: Textured links earrings
description: Fine silver links are textured on both sides and lightly patinaed.  The larger links measure 1.5cm in diameter, and the length (excluding the sterling earwires) is 3.25cm.  I have bracelets and necklaces to match, and I will be listing them soon.

name: Melissa Pendant
description: The honeybee is an avatar of the Goddess, and her handmaidens were called "melissae", meaning "bees".  This fine silver pendant is an exact replica of a melissa leaf (the plant is commonly called "bee balm"), and the bee on the leaf is holding a beautiful orange-gold natural sapphire.  Included is a sterling silver beaded snake chain with a lobster-claw clasp.

name: Goddess of Compassion Pendant
description: This fine silver pendant with three Labradorite drops represents the goddess who "hears the cry of the world".  The face is an adaptation of the face of a small winged goddess figure from India, which sits on the bedside table of a dear friend. This piece is one-of-a-kind, made by hand.  The pendant is 1 1/2" tall and 1 3/8" wide (not counting the drops, and comes on a 22" sterling silver chain with a small round toggle clasp.

name: vintage disc tag earrings
description: Handmade fine silver earrings with riveted discs (front and back) cut from vintage advertising tins, 2.5 cm x 1.5 cm, sterling earwires.  The discs on this pair were cut from a candy tin that I bought at a flea market in southern France.

name: vintage disc tag earrings 2
description: Handmade fine silver (from Precious Metal Clay) earrings with riveted discs (front and back) cut from vintage advertising tins, 2.5 cm x 1.5 cm, sterling earwires.  The discs on this pair are from an old American tobacco tin.  The discs on the back are from a vintage candy tin.
